meanings.definition: Diazins: a class of chemical compounds containing a six-membered ring with four carbon atoms and two nitrogen atoms.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study diazins to understand their chemical properties.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician analyzed various diazins under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The diazins in the beaker seemed to be having a tiny party.
meanings.sent4: In the world of molecules, diazins are like intricate puzzles waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The textbook illustration vividly depicted the structure of diazins.

meanings.definition: Diazins: plural form of diazin, referring to multiple instances of the chemical compound.
meanings.sent1: The researchers collected samples of different diazins for their experiment.
meanings.sent2: The market offers a wide range of diazins for industrial use.
meanings.sent3: The diazins on the shelf looked like a colorful collection of tiny bottles.
meanings.sent4: In the lab, the various diazins danced together in a complex chemical reaction.
meanings.sent5: The warehouse stored barrels filled with different diazins for distribution.
